data.title: Numbers in English and Spanish
data.statement:
Input is a [[languageLetter]] followed by a [[number]]

Print the [[number]] out in words ([[numbersAsWords]]) in either English or Spanish (depending on the [[languageLetter]])
   {{e}} or {{E}} is for English
   {{s}} or {{S}} is for Spanish

Some helpful info is already in the program stub.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut:
e496 reads as four nine six
E72 reads as seven two
s3 reads as tres
S2606 reads as dos seis cero seis

data.stubGenerator:
read howMany:int
loop howMany read input:string(200)
write The number in words

STATEMENT
English 0 thru 9 is zero one two three four five six seven eight nine
Spanish 0 thru 9 is cero, uno, dos, tres, cuatro, cinco, seis, siete, ocho, nueve
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[howMany]] cases will follow
<<Next [[howMany]] Lines:>> A string, [[input]], consisting of [[languageLetter]] [[number]] (no spaces)
data.outputDescription: <<[[howMany]] Lines:>> A string [[input]] {{ reads as }} [[numbersAsWords]] (each of which is separated by a space)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Input is a languageLetter followed by a number

Print the number out in words (numbersAsWords) in either English or Spanish (depending on the languageLetter)
e or E is for English
s or S is for Spanish

Some helpful info is already in the program stub.
Input
Line 1: An integer howMany cases will follow
Next howMany Lines: A string, input, consisting of languageLetter number (no spaces)
Output
howMany Lines: A string input reads as numbersAsWords (each of which is separated by a space)
Constraints
number is a non-negative integer.
Example
Input
4
e496
E72
s3
S2606
Output
e496 reads as four nine six
E72 reads as seven two
s3 reads as tres
S2606 reads as dos seis cero seis
